item.title: Can scp create a directory if it doesn't exist?
item.author: 273412935@qq.com (龙哥)
item.description: Can scp create a directory if it doesn’t exist? As far as I know, scp itself cannot do that, no. However, you could just ssh to the target machine, create the directory and then copy. Something like: 1 2 ssh user@host "mkdir -p /target/path/" && scp /path/to/source user@host:/target/path/ Note that if you are copying entire directories, the above is not needed.
